i found another ~~bug~~:
after editing `data/users/youruserid/data.json`, if we sign `data/users/youruserid/content.json` via UI, and finally publish via UI, the change is taken place on remote peers but not in local browser. we have to post something via UI to make the change take place in local browser. i guess the cause is even though `data/users/youruserid/data.json` changes, the SQLite db is not automatically updated after clicking the `Publish` button.

> [197](#comment_1_15JNF8bdyG4zEWVASsgbkFirzM6gyYpSBA): I strongly oppose the "We are on our own" point.

Tor is funded by US gov does NOT mean it is profit oriented. Further more, Tor is totally open-sourced, which is essentially different from those profit oriented company.
Similarly, ZeroNet can be funded, but never be profit oriented, or "profitable". Facebook attract users because it can give users money? Non-profit project can not attract users because it can not give users money?

> [197](#comment_2_15JNF8bdyG4zEWVASsgbkFirzM6gyYpSBA): We are not profit oriented, but we should not give up on those who are. 

they can contribute to zeronet, "We are on our own" does not mean keep them away.
is linux sustainable? is linux profitable?
microsoft  also contributes to the Linux kernel, even though it focussed more on code that will improve the compatibility with microsoft products.
http://unix.stackexchange.com/questions/178615/why-does-microsoft-contribute-to-the-linux-kernel
as linux grows, they have to adopt it, rather than asking them to adopt it. years ago, someone might say linux is not meaningful for most people. however, today, most people have linux-powered devices, e.g. android devices, routers...

> [197](#comment_3_15JNF8bdyG4zEWVASsgbkFirzM6gyYpSBA): We largely have Google to thank for Android

pls think about the difference between linux kernel and linux distribution. Android, CentOS,  Ubuntu are linux distributions. although these companies contribute to linux kernel, i don't think they can have strong influence to linux kernel developing direction.
why does the first heavy-weight initial adopter come? ask for it, or even beg for it? NO! when your thing is good, they'll come naturally.
